column1: nibbling in on a length, steered out towards point
pushed across Warner at 84mph/136kph, no real bounce in the surface as it dribbles past the outside edge to Buttler on the bounce
length ball, bit of in-nip, and Warner shoulders arms to let it fly over the top
full for the first time, Warner pushes forward and steers down to third man with more than a hint of outside edge. These two are rapid between the wickets, and fly back for the second
length ball just outside leg, nudged to forward square leg via the pad
hard length, Warner rides the bounce and punches through the covers. Slight misfield in the covers by Billings and Warner barks 'yes yes yes!' for the second run
speared down the leg side at 86mph/138kph, called wide as Finch lets it fly past his backside
in the slot outside off, freebie from Archer as Finch leans on the drive and flays it through wide mid-off for four!
back of a length, flies through off the pitch at 86mph/139kph as Finch pulls out of the flick to leg at the last minute
bit of inswing at 88mph/141kph, clipped out to square leg for one, via the pad
beauty! Beaten, groping at an away-nibbler on fourth stump. Length ball at 87mph/141kph, Warner presses forward and it beats his outside edge
Warner defends more confidently this time, pressing out towards mid-off
hung wide of the off stump - very wide in fact, and umpire Millns tells Archer to bowl another
length on off stump, pushed out to extra cover for a sharp single
length ball, late swing past the stumps as Warner leaves it alone, and Buttler fumbles diving to his right
hung wide of the off stump, loose waft from Warner who can't get bat on it
outswinger, hung outside off again; and again, Warner flashes and misses
clipped down to long leg off the hip
outswinger on a length, jammed out towards cover
fullish length ball, clipped to short midwicket

ripper, Archer gets Warner again! 90mph/144kph, bit of late movement to beat Warner's defences, and Archer pegs back the top of his off stump! That's an absolute beauty, and England have a breakthrough. Warner's stunned facial expression tells the story - as close to unplayable as it gets
short ball, Stoinis leans awkwardly over towards the off side to get out the way of it. 85mph/137kph
back of a length outside off at 86mph/138kph, flies off the surface through to Buttler as Stoinis leaves it alone
length outside off, 89mph/144kph and it races away as Stoinis leans on the cover drive. Billings gives chase, and just about manages to cut it off with a dive
hung outside off, Finch leaves this alone
hard length, flies through to Buttler with good carry
slightly full of a length on the pads, clipped down to long leg
outswinger on the pads, clipped out towards short midwicket. Half-baked appeal from Buttler, but two noises, and looked like it pitched outside leg to me
presses out to short extra cover for a sharp single
length down the leg side, Stoinis can't get bat on it but it's called wide

slightly overpitched on the pads from wide on the crease. Stoinis clips through straight midwicket towards the longest boundary on the ground, and it just about creeps over the toblerone thanks to some good timing
length on fourth stump, seems to hold in the pitch as Stoinis steers down to third man
hard length in the off-stump channel, inside-edged into the pad and it dribbles towards extra cover. Sharp single - good running, again
hard length, Finch rocks back to nudge towards midwicket on the back foot
drags his length back a touch, Finch steers towards point, jumping onto the back foot
short and wide, Finch misses out looking to cut, failing to beat the man at cover
slightly fuller, bowled from tight to the stumps and an immaculate fourth-stump line. Finch has no choice but to defend
short ball, pulled off the hip for four! Lovely controlled pull, 87mph/140kph, but Finch picks up the length early and it races away behind square
sharp bumper at the left shoulder, 91mph/146kph. Finch doesn't take on the hook this time and ducks underneath it
straight, length ball, pushed towards mid-on
length ball on the stumps, clipped through midwicket for a couple as Moeen gives chase
fullish on fourth stump, driven out to straight mid-off
length on fourth stump, 83mph/133kph and a bit of nibble in off the seam. Stoinis leaves it alone and grimaces as it flies just past the off stump!
length on fourth stump, Stoinis defends towards mid-on
fullish on off stump, pressed out towards short cover
hung outside off at 88mph/142kph, Finch shoulders arms and it flies through to Buttler again
slower ball outside off, driven out to mid-off. Looked like he ran his fingers down the side of it, with his pace down at 77mph/124kph
length ball, Finch is through the shot early and chips it up towards midwicket. They squeeze through for a sharp single, as it lands safely

short ball, Stoinis jumps to defend towards midwicket from very deep in the crease and steals a single. Archer fields in his follow-through and hurls towards the stumps at the bowler's end, but misses! Stoinis might have been safe, even with a direct hit
sharp bouncer at the left shoulder, Finch ducks underneath it. 90mph/145kph
length on the stumps, defended towards mid-on from deep in the crease. 90mph/146kph, rushing Finch into a shot
length ball on middle, defended to that man in tight on the leg side
slower ball on leg stump, clipped behind square for a single

length ball, Finch fences out it outside off and steers it through the vacant fourth-slip region for four! Finch was jumping back and opened the face, nudging it wide of the man in the cordon and fine of third man
lunges forward to a fuller ball in the channel, pushing straight to extra cover
clipped out to deep square off the pads
slightly back of a length outside off, Stoinis punches through the covers on the back foot, staying very compact, but times it well enough for it to run away for four

nicks him off, Wood strikes with his first ball! Length ball on fourth stump, no foot movement from Finch who gets a faint but audible nick through to Buttler, and England are jubilant! Hung back, deep in his crease as though setting himself for the bouncer, but Wood hit a length and Buttler did the rest
driven towards mid-on, loud cry of 'WAITING!' from Marnus. 92mph/148kph from Wood
length outside off, left alone. Bit of late tail in on its way through to Buttler. 90mph/145kph
Wood bangs this in at 91mph/147kph on a length, Labuschagne clips behind square on the leg side, possibly with a hint of inside edge
fullish on fourth stump, presses out to mid-on where Morgan dives to his left to cut it off
length outside off, Stoinis looks to presses through the off side but it squirts away behind square on the leg side thanks to an inside edge, and they race back for a second run
length on sixth stump, Labuschagne shuffles across then leaves alone
Labuschagne plants his back foot across towards the off side, Woakes hangs another one in the channel and he leaves alone
drags his length back a touch, punched out towards cover with a bellow of 'NO RUN!'
length on off stump, clipped to short midwicket where Moeen fields
length on fifth stump, steered towards backward point
half-volley on fourth stump, driven dead-straight past the stumps. Times it brilliantly, straight back past the bowler and away for four
slammed in at 88mph/142kph, Stoinis jams the bat down to punch towards cover
hard length again, but too much width this time and Stoinis gets it away through the ring. Times the square drive nicely, threading it between cover and backward point
length outside off, genuine edge as he looks to punch through cover-point, beating third man to his left
beauty, slightly full of a length as Stoinis comes forward to defend, and finds himself pushing at thin air as this flies past his edge
short ball at the left shoulder, swatted away behind square for four! 90mph/145kph bumper, but Stoinis picks the length up early and guides it to the boundary with a pull
slightly full of a length on fourth stump, nudged out to mid-on. 92mph/148kph
tossed up wide of the off stump, and guided out to mid-off
big appeal for lbw, but hits him outside the line as Labuschagne gets over to the off side. Slightly full of a length, turning in, and looped up to Root at slip - but no inside edge
gets forward to push back down the pitch towards Moeen
no real turn, Marnus clips off the pads out to deep backward square
full on the stumps, slashed out to deep cover via a leading edge. Looked as though Stoinis was trying to thump this over mid-off!
Labuschagne gets down to sweep, stealing a second run to the man at deep square
banged in on a length at 87mph/140kph, inside edged into the leg side for a scuttled single
beaten outside off! 89mph/144kph in the channel, Labuschagne defends with his bat away from his pad and the ball flies past the outside edge
a fraction back of a length on fourth stump, 89mph/144kph, and nudged towards mid-on
fuller on fifth stump, nudged towards mid-on. 92mph/147kph
fenced out to deep cover, and they take on the second run even with Billings haring round to his right on the rope
length on fifth stump, fenced out towards gully
full outside off, and driven against the turn through the gap. Finds Woakes manning the extra cover boundary
up and over! Eyes on the ball to see where it drops, and he takes a big stride to tonk it over the vacant cover region!
good length on off, and he rocks back to punch  to mid on
good length, just outside off, and tapped off the back foot to Moeen
fullish, just outside off. Pushed with soft hands to the off side
full just outside off, and punched with the bat's open face to cover point. Enough time to take the second run
goes short, but Labuschagne swivels in a flash and pummels a pull past the square-leg umpire, who himself shows some good footwork to avoid getting hit

edged and taken! Bowls full, tempting Stoinis to drive, but the ball takes the outside edge and Buttler needs to dive to his right to take the catch. That was quick! A good innings from Stoinis in a position he usually doesn't bat in, but with the start he got, he will feel disappointed not capitalizing
back of a length to Marsh, angling into his body, and guided to fine leg
fullish, on off, and tapped off the back foot to cover. Hurries him onto the back foot
good length, fifth stump line, and he tiptoes before shouldering his arms on this occasion
back of a length, and he comfortably gets behind the line of the ball to block
fullish, outside off, and he gets down on one knee to paddle sweep to fine leg for a double
good length, outside off, and enough time for him to go deep in his crease before punching to long off
good length, on off. Skids back and fends to mid on on this occasion
a big sweep, from outside off, and finds deep midwicket, where Billings cuts it off. Might have been a premeditated shot if you ask me
full, just outside off. Big stride forward to defend back to the bowler
full on off, and this time he sweeps squarer than before, forcing Billings to give the ball a futile chase. A good end to the over, and Moeen's economy remains over 7
full on off, and he puts one leg across the stumps to play a fine paddle sweep that forces fine leg to scurry
full on off, and he defends the legbreak back to Rashid. Nice flourish of the bat.
good length, on middle. Paddled behind square
good length, on middle, but too short. The googly goes further down leg, and Marsh flicks gently past the keeper's left for a deft-touch boundary
good length, outside off, and he tries to cut but misses
good length, on off. Turning away and punched off the back foot to mid off
what happened there? Overpitched, and the ball goes under the drive, and turns enough to go between the keeper's legs. Umpire thinks it came off the bat but I'd disagree
good length ball, and tucked to midwicket
overpitched, just outside off, and swept to deep midwicket
good length, outside off. Uncomfortable stride forward, and defended to cover
full on middle, and he clears the front leg to drive to long on
good length, on middle. Punched with soft hands towards the non-striker
full outside off, and the googly is driven to extra cover. Off the bat's middle

full just outside off and the googly comes into him. Big stride forward to defend, but hits his front leg, and the lbw appeal is given out! Marnus reviews right away No bat involved, and that's pitched just outside off, and hit off stump. Labuschagne needs to go. Rashid gets the wicket via the googly. Australia in all sorts of trouble
reverse sweep first ball! The audacity, you'd think. Googly, full and smacked to the left-hander's point region
good length, on middle, and paddled to short fine leg.
good length, on off, and turning in. Flicked off his hips to deep midwicket
good length, on off, and turning away from the lefty. Tries to guide it past the keeper but pulls his bat back at the end
full on middle, and defended
full on off, and pushed back
loopy, full, and he takes a giant stride to hammer a drive past the fielder cover and extra cover!
back of a length, outside off. Punched back to Moeen after walking across
full on off, and pushed to mid on. Can't find the gap
full on off, and pushed to long off for a jogging single
half tracker on middle, and googling down the leg side. Flicked, but finds short fine leg
another short ball, and the googly is pulled along the ground to Wood at deep backward square leg
top edged and shouts of catch it as he sweeps this full ball. Nobody there at square leg though
good length, outside off. Ball holds up a bit as Marsh tries to punch through cover. Inside edged to midwicket instead
tossed up on middle, and an expansive cover drive is edged to third man instead. Shouts of catch it again
another loopy ball, offering Marsh to take the drive route, and he does, but flies off the inside-splice to mid on instead
full on middle, and flicked off his toes to deep midwicket
full on off, from around the wicket, and nudged away to midwicket off his toes
fullish, outside off but Marsh goes onto the back foot to meet the ball. Pushed to cover
bit of a quicker one, drags it short, on mdidle, and angling into leg. Marsh tries to pull, but finds short fine leg
fullish, on off, and fended off the back foot. Moeen's economy under six for the first time
defended
good length, on middle, and paddled to deep backward square leg
good length, on off, and flicked off his hips to square leg

Best score in cricket, quips Matt Roller as Australia are one two three fo(u)r five! Full, on leg, and the sweep's top edge finally has a player at square leg to take the catch. Runs across towards short fine leg and takes a simply one. That's Rashid's second
full, just outside off, and defended with a big stride
another nicely tossed up ball, this time on off. Driven straight back
back of a length, just outside off, and he rides the bounce to tap it towards point

full, on off, and the attempted straight drive is mistimed to mid on instead. The fielder at mid on has a shy at the stumps, but its an awry throw. Buttler's nowhere near, the fielder backing up has no chance either, and that's run away for some more free runs. Moeen Ali the guilty fielder. Reckon those runs should be added to his bowling tally
back of a length, on off, and punched right back to the bowler
slower ball that does not come out right. Ends up as a dipping full toss, and driven to cover. Decent ball to be fair because Marsh was quite surprised

good length, knuckle ball outside off. He's through the drive too early so needs to adjust at the last moment while giving the bat a push. Hits the top half of the bat, but he ensures he plays with soft hands so that the ball doesn't pop up into the air
good length, on off. Turning away, and pushed off the back foot to point
good length, outside off and turning further away. Maxwell walks across the stumps and cuts in front of square
nice delivery, full on off and skidding through. Giant stride forward to defend
good length, outside off, and cut off the back foot. Finds deep point
full on middle, and he wants to play the chip drive but eventually just hits it back to Rashid
full on off, and a bit of turn away. Defended towards cover
back of a length, but not short enough. Rides the bounce to defend
fullish, outside off, and through to the keeper
full on middle, and the straight drive finds mid on
back of a length, short on off, and he ducks under it. Bat is upwards though, which isn't good hygiene. Could've hit that and popped up in the air
jaffa from Jof. Good length, on off, and moving slightly away as Marsh looks to defend. Ball whizzes past his outside edge
back of a length, on off and fended off the back foot
length ball on middle, and angling into his pads. Flicked to square leg, where there's a fielder
full on middle, and the attempted defense off the front foot comes off the bat's inside half. Rolls towards mid on
full on leg, and the googly takes it further down leg. Misses the bat, and the lbw appeal is turned down
full outside off, and defended with the turn to cover
good length, on middle, and he rocks back to work it away - off his hips - to deep midwicket
full, and wide, in the slot to be punished. But mistimed to cover
good length, outside off, and he hammers a cut to the fielder at the deep
full, in the slot outside off, and he clobbers a drive through the covers! Fielder at deep point a mere formality
good length, on middle. Tapped back to mid on
back of a length, on middle, and rising over his shoulder.
length ball, on middle, and punched off the back foot to mid on
good length, on leg, and nudged behind square to the sweeper-fielder on the leg side
full on leg, with Maxwell offering an open stance. Tucked to short fine leg

here we go! Half tracker outside off, and he breaks his wrists to loft this over sub fielder Banton over deep midwicket! Nearly goes all the way. Maxwell met the ball too much in front of him, forcing him to generate a bit less power than he would've liked
good length, outside off, and cut with the turn to the deep
full, on middle. Tapped to the bowler's left
length ball, on leg stump, and worked to Banton at deep midwicket
short, wide, turning away. Cut with disdain, but finds the sweeper on the off side
good length, on middle. Turned off his hips to square leg
full on off, and punched off the back foot to long on
full, on middle. Defended straight back
wristy drive! Full, outside off, and driven against the turn, past the fielder at cover, and it races away to the cover boundary
quicker ball, length ball, and worked to the leg side
pulls the half tracker along the ground to deep midwicket
back of a length, rapping him hard on the top of the bat as Marsh tries to fend off the back foot
full, just outside off, and crunched off the front foot to extra cover
back of a length, on  off and angling into middle. Fended off the back foot, from near his <strike>tummy</strike> abs. He expected the ball to rise further up
full, and wide, and the square cut is played along the ground to point
good length, on off, and tapped off the back foot to cover
overpitched on off, a bit of drift into him. Toe-ends a drive to the off side
full on middle, and he reaches forward to drive to cover point
full, on off. Stretches forward to defend with soft hands
overpitched on middle, and he tonks a drive to long off, where there's protection
full on off, and this time the drive is hammered to long on
good length, on leg stump. Defended with soft hands towards the non striker
full on middle, and the attempted cover drive takes an inside edge to square leg instead
beaten by the pace! Back of a length, and he swivels to pull, but the ball goes through him before he could swing the bat across his face
back of a length, on off, and uncomfortably hit towards the leg side for a scampered run
back of a length, outside off. Rising delivery, and smartly punched after riding the bounce. Protection at extra cover though
full and wide, and he drives with the bat's open face. Races across the ground as third man can't cut it off. Using the bowler's pace so well there
back of a length, outside off. Punched away off the back foot
fullish, on off, and driven towards cover for a quick single. Drinks too
clipped behind square on the leg side for one
whips out the reverse, Moeen speared this in full on leg stump to counter after he switched round early, but Maxwell is so good at this shot, and nails it behind square on the off side
nudged out towards midwicket to keep Australia ticking over
length ball, punched out to long-on off the back foot
full on off stump, thumped straight to Morgan at short extra cover
slashed through the gap between cover and extra this time, slightly overpitched from Moeen and Maxwell frees his arms, whipping a wristy drive away for four
beaten outside off. 92mph/147kph on a length, rushing Marsh, who jams the bat down on it late
slightly full of a length, 91mph/147kph, and pushed out towards mid-on
banged in on a length, steered behind square on the off side. 'Noooo... yep,' cries Marsh as it just about evades the dive of backward point. He thinks about two, then barks: 'Not now!'
banged in on a length, 91mph/146kph, and rushes Maxwell. He looks to work to leg, but is struck on the thigh pad, and it loops up tantalisingly, dropping just in front of him
shorter outside off, and Maxwell pulls in front of square. Through the shot slightly earlier, and only one run to the sweeper
length ball that would have hit the top of off stump, defended towards mid-on. Tight over!
nudged towards midwicket
length on the pads, clipped out to deep square
fullish on off stump, clipped to long-on
length on the pads, clipped out towards deep square. Archer flies round from fine leg to stop the second run
straight length ball from tight to the stumps, can't beat straight midwicket
flat offbreak on middle stump, clipped out to deep backward square
low full toss, clipped to mid-on
tossed up very wide of the off stump, and Maxwell slashes out to Billings, lurking on the cover boundary
big swing from Maxwell, big turn from Rashid, and top-edged between Buttler and Root! Given as byes, but I'm convinced he hit it EDIT: Yep, confirmed by the replay, big edge there
slashed away for a single into the off side
pushed out towards extra cover
full outside off, driven down to long-off to bring up 50.
length on the hip, clipped to Archer at short midwicket. He misfields, but there's no second run
length on fifth stump, Maxwell jumps to fence out into the covers
length on fourth stump, heaved out to the leg side in front of square and it runs away for four! That takes Australia past 200.
length on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
offcutter on the stumps, Marsh nudges towards midwicket
slower ball again, fenced out to deep cover to keep hold of the strike
ooft, through Root's dive at slip and away for four! Big turn past Marsh's outside edge, it beats Buttler to his right and Root can't get a hand on it despite throwing himself to his left
drag-down, but he escapes with a single, as Marsh pulls straight to long leg

tosses up a legbreak, Maxwell decides to take it on and sends it miles over the midwicket rope! Huge six, helped by the wind no doubt but that would have been six on most grounds, flying into the top tier
full on fifth stump, slashed out to deep cover to bring up Maxwell's fifty. Great knock so far, timing the ball nicely and opening up all sorts of hitting zones with this new stance
carved away behind square on the off side for one
opens the face, guiding the ball out towards deep cover
back of a length outside off, can't beat the fielder at point
clipped to wide mid-on, can't beat the fielder
slower ball outside off, whipped from outside off towards mid-on, and it beats a half-hearted effort from Archer in the ring. Woakes doesn't look too pleased
worked towards Archer at mid-on again, fields it well this time
offcutter, slightly back of a length, nudged out to deep midwicket by Marsh
yorker, nudged to Archer at mid-on who hurls at the stumps, despite the fact Maxwell is clearly in. Backed up without any problems, but that earns him a quizzical look from Woakes!
back of a length, steered out to midwicket but Bairstow races in from the boundary to cut off the second run
big legbreak on a length, fenced out to deep cover. 'No mate!' yells Maxwell, with Marsh considering a second
tossed up outside off, Maxwell slashes over the ring but his timing is awry, and Billings fields on the bounce
fullish on fourth stump, Marsh lunges forward to defend
legbreak outside off, punched out to point
nope, not today. Full on the stumps, and pushed down to long-on

Maxwell shimmies outside leg, but Woakes follows him with a length ball. He gets enough bat on this to send it down to fine leg, perhaps with a hint of inside edge, and Maxwell is quick enough to race back for two
length on fifth stump, swatted out to deep midwicket with a short-arm pull
speared in on the pads, clipped out to deep square

full toss down the leg side, but Maxwell misses out, just clipped towards midwicket. Attempted slower ball which went horribly wrong, but Maxwell almost seemed surprised to receive such a pie, and only managed to nudge into the leg side
heaved out to Billings on the rope at deep midwicket, only a single
backs away to leg again, and Woakes follows him with a low full toss, which is clipped out to long-on for a single

in the slot on the stumps, Maxwell frees his arms looking to go leg side and sends it sailing high and mighty over the rope! Lots of elevation, but enough distance on it to fly over the midwicket boundary

low full toss, and Maxwell flicks it over deep backward square for six more! Not a great ball, and Maxwell just clipped it over the rope with a little whip, the wind doing most of the hard work for him
chopped on! Slower ball, slightly short outside off, Maxwell looked to heave over the leg side but only managed to drag it onto his stumps via the toe of the bat. Big moment in this match
short ball, Cummins sways inside the line and awkwardly upper-cut down to third man
short outside off, Marsh drops the hands and lets it go
back of a length on fourth stump, Marsh jumps onto the back foot to defend
back of a length, guided out to cover to get off strike
slower ball, jammed in outside off, and Marsh slugs legside out to Billings at deep midwicket. He crunched this, but straight to the fielder on the rope
in the slot on the stumps, and beats that man inside the ring. Heaved in front of square, nicely timed and away for four!
clipped off the hip down to Rashid at fine leg for a couple

ooft, nearly another chop-on. Length outside off, Cummins inside-edges into the pad, and it dribbles out towards the covers. Wood races after it in his follow-through as Cummins sets off for a single, before he's sent back by Marsh
slightly back of a length at 87mph/141kph, and Cummins heaves out to deep square to keep the strike

length outside off, slashed miles up into the air, and the man at cover in the ring holds on! Archer is laughing - did Morgan nearly drop this?! Ooft, yeah, almost slipped out as he went Australian-style with the hands up. This looked like a knuckleball - plenty of room for Cummins to free his arms, but he was through the shot far too early
banged into the pitch, Marsh can't lay a glove on it
short ball, pulled out to deep square for one

short outside off, Starc heaves it up towards the edge of the ring on the legside and Billings is racing in from the midwicket boundary... but can't hang on! 86mph/140kph bumper, Billings got there, diving forwards, but couldn't cling on as it popped out of the hands
slower ball, back of a length, and pulled away for one more
length on fourth stump, heaved out to wide mid-on for a couple
banged in on a length again, pulled out to Root who gets round from deep backward square
short ball, looked like it stuck in the hand somewhat as Wood attempted a change-up, and Marsh pulls down to fine leg
full and wide, carved down to third man
speared down the leg side at 89mph/143kph, called wide
clipped out to long leg, and they squeeze back for the second
short outside off, clothed towards long-on as he attempts a pull, but he times it so badly that it takes a while for the man on the rope to come in, and they get back for a second

struck on the pad, and the finger goes up! Marsh reviews immediately. Looked pretty good to the naked eye, and Ultra-Edge says there's no bat involved. Hit in-line, and hitting middle-and-leg three-quarters of the way up! Marsh has to depart after a gritty 73. He was looking to get off strike with a push into the leg side towards midwicket, but Wood did him for pace.
slot ball, Starc plays a beautiful on-drive to clear mid-on inside the ring! Textbook stuff, high front elbow, and a poor start to Archer's final over
clipped down to long leg for a single
pushed gently out into the covers, and they race back for a second
slower ball - knuckleball, I think - and Zampa is through the shot early looking to guide it through the off side
spears in a yorker at the toes, 93mph/150kph, clipped towards wide mid-on
short ball, Starc fends at it awkwardly and it loops up behind square on the off side but lands safely
full outside off, fenced out to deep cover

speared in full and straight, Zampa gives himself room and nudges to mid-off, setting off immediately for the single. Woakes throws towards the keeper's end, just over Wood's head, but Starc is safely home
slower ball, Starc backs away looks to slash over the infield on the off side but can't lay a bat on it, and Buttler makes an excellent one-handed diving stop
banged in on a length, Starc punches out to Morgan at short extra cover and sneaks through for a single
length ball, nudged towards the covers as Zampa backs away. They take on a sharp single, Wood kicks towards the stumps at the keeper's end but Starc is comfortably in even as the ball hits the stumps
full, quick and wide outside off, Starc clears the front leg to give himself room but can't lay a bat on it
back of a length, offcutter, and Zampa is through the shot very early, trying to heave into the leg side
jams in a yorker on fifth stump, which Zampa squeezes out for a single towards point
slower ball, back of a length, and carved out to extra cover. Root throws at the stumps, and the ball thumps Woakes on the wrist as he tries to whip the bails off! Starc survives
slower ball bouncer again, Zampa looks for another wild, cross-batted heave and can't get any bat on it
short ball, back of a length, and Zampa top-edges the pull straight up into the air... Woakes pouches it! Australia lose their ninth, and Woakes has a wicket to show for his efforts

length ball, pace off again, but Starc picks it this time and nails it over midwicket for a towering six! Free swing of the arms, and it lands on the hover-cover 10 yards over the boundary. That's only the third boundary Australia have managed since Maxwell was out in the 44th over
full, just inside the tramlines and left alone by the batsman
nice shape! Good length on off, and getting big on him. Nearly takes the outside edge to the keeper
full, on off, and he taps this tentatively off the front foot to mid off
length ball on off, and angling further away. Enough room to free his arms to clatter a cut but can't get bat on ball. A lucky escape for Starc, one could say
that's five dot balls.
back of a length, on leg stump, and shaping further down. Roy considered flicking it fine...
full on off, and he looks to play the straight drive but it makes a weird hollow sound off the bat (a sign of a mistime) as the ball rolls away to mid off
good length, outside off, and angling further away. Wide given
good length, on off, and defended off the back foot, with the bat's open face. Bairstow wants the run, but third slip runs across to end that thought
full, just outside off, and he takes a big stride to cover off stump, and then shoulders his arms
through him! Good length outside off, and coming into off stump. Bairstow wants to defend off the back foot but the ball zoots inwards and goes between bat and body
full on off, and he walks into a front foot defense
full, and slightly wide, allowing YJB to free his arms. Crunches a drive, but stopped by mid off scurrying to his left
first runs off the bat as Bairstow punches this length ball into the gap between cover and mid off
full ball, but pushes it wider, forcing Bairstow to drive, but he can't connect. Starc searching for the swing there, but didn't get any
good length on off, and punched to Warner at cover, who gets a direct hit at the keeper's end but they're safe. No runs off the overthrows either
back of a length, on middle, and he mistimes the grounded pull. Work for Cummins to the square-leg boundary, and he manages to save one
good length, on middle, and he closes the bat's face to turn it leg side
back of a length on middle, and getting big on YJB as he tries to go for the pull. Ball goes over his blade though.
pushes it slightly further up, on off, and pushed off the front foot to mid off, but to the fielder
good length, outside off, kinda close to his body for the cut, but goes for it anyway. Misses, and shall be glad that didn't take a tickle to the keeper
back of a length, outside off, and he opens the bat's face to punch a bit squarer. Finds cover point though
good length on middle, and Roy comes down the wicket to try and muscle it over Bairstow's head, but the ball goes through bat and body and into Carey's gloves
back of a length, bit of extra bounce and Roy has to defend from near his chest

what a stunner! A one-handed grab... on his followthrough, that's epic from Hazlewood! Not full enough for the drive, yet he drives, but the ball comes off the actual middle of the bat - which isn't really the sweet spot - and Hazlewood maintains his balance to stick his right hand out and the ball stays in his palm. Big wicket t
good length, just outside off, a bit of shape away. Root looks to defend off the back foot but the ball goes through to the keeper
full on off, and defended off the front foot. Straight back to Starc, but along the ground, unlike the Roy dismissal
good length, outside off and angling away. Wants to cut but makes no connection. A tad extra bounce this time
first boundary and is that the release shot that will get Bairstow going? Another length ball angling away, and he cuts in front of square
back of a length on off, and angling away again. This time the punch finds cover, with Maxi diving to his right
good from bowler and batsman as the pinpoint short ball sees Bairstow drop his knees and duck under the delivery
good length on leg, and tickled off his hips to square leg
back of a length, just outside off, and left alone
full, just outside off, and Root presses forward to defend from under his eyes. But the ball moves slightly away, and just goes past the outside edge
full, on middle, and driven straight just past the stumps, but Zampa does well to cut the ball from mid on and ensure the pressure remains on Root
good length, outside off, and Root goes onto the back foot to punch, but the ball goes under his bat
good length on middle, and he rocks back to fend off the back foot
good length, on the fourth-stump line and Root is happy to just defend off the back foot
good length, outside off, and punched to the left of cover, and that brings Root back on strike
good length, outside off, and guided off the back foot to point
good length, outside off, and the attempted back-foot jab takes an inside edge to mid off instead
good length, on middle, and pulled along the ground to deep backward square leg
back of a length, on off, and fended off the back foot
fullish, just outside off, and pushed to the off side
tickle to the keeper! Good length, outside off, and he looks to defend off the back foot, but the tiny bit of movement away takes the edge to Carey
full on off, and fended with soft hands
good length, on middle, and tapped gently to the off side to get off the mark. Shy at the stumps from Warner, but it goes over the stumps
good length, on middle. Inside-edged onto his pads, and rolls away to the off side
good length, on off, and he shoulders his arms and the ball goes over the stumps
good length, on middle, and defended off the back foot
full, on middle, and the on-drive squirts away to mid on
good length, on off, and angling away. Nudged off the back foot to cover
back of a length, on off, and angling further away. Left alone
thumped! Finally times that punch to perfection. Slightly overpitched and hammered past the non-striker
full on off, and defended towards cover. Just checked his drive there
good length, outside off, and fended off the back foot with the bat's open face to point
full on off, and he goes towards the off side to try and drive through mid on, but he inside-edges the shot onto his pads
full just outside off, and the attempted prod takes an inside edge square to the leg side. Two runs taken as the fielder at midwicket needs to scurry to square leg
back of a length, outside off and angling into him. Through to the keeper as Bairstow shoulders his arms
back of a length, on off. Tries to pull, but under-edges the shot onto his ribs. Ouch!
good length, on off, and he defends this to the leg side

that's a third wicket! Unless...aha.. Bairstow reviews. This was a length ball outside off that stayed low, hits Bairstow on the front leg on middle stump, and the replays show this would've gone down leg side! Good review, Bairstow survives, and that's the end of 10 overs
one bounce four as Morgan quickly pounces on this leg-stump line bouncer. Finds the fine leg boundary
good length, on off, and he waits to play the late cut. Protection in the deep though
fullish, just outside off. Presses forward to play a check drive, but goes past the outside edge
leading edge but along the ground. Tries to nudge this to the leg side but the ball flies to point instead
good length outside off, and he defends with soft hands towards cover
back of a length, outside off, and pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
good length ball, outside off and angling into off stump. Fended off the back foot
fullish, just outside off, and he skewers a drive to cover
good length, outside off, and punched off the back foot with the bat's open face to point
back of a length, on off. Tries to pull, but through the shot too early. Hits his shoulder

Carey and Finch appeal for caught behind but the bowler isn't interested and they don't review. This cut the batsman in half as the length ball angled in and went between bat and body... very nearly clipped leg stump too
full on off, and driven to mid off. Straight to the fielder
good length, on middle and angling across. Punched through the covers, where a misfield allows them to take a few more runs
full on off, and crunched past Morgan! Has four written all over it, except that Starc dives to his left from mid off to stop the boundary
back of a length on middle, and he tries to pull, and it hits his waist before popping up in the air
back of a length, on middle, and he drops under the ball's line
back of a length, on leg stump, and once again he gets under the line of the ball. The umpire sticks out two fingers.. not the peace sign from him, he's letting Cummins know that's two bouncers
squirted in the air, but falls in the vacant long off region. This was a length ball that Morgan top-edged over the infield while trying to play a flat-batted shot
good length, outside off, and clobbered through point! Got into position early for the cut
good length, on off, and defended with soft hands to mid on. They scamper across for a quick run
here we go! Full, outside off and he runs down the ground to smash a six over wide long off! He;s taking no prisoners here.
good length, on leg stump, and he tries to pull along the ground, but the ball hits his thighs instead
length ball on leg stump, and nudged off his hips to square leg
back of a length, on middle, and tucked off his hips to the leg side
good length, on leg stump. Sharp turn down the leg side though
good length on leg, and Morgan comes down the wicket. It hits his pads and rolls away to the leg side
brave of Bairstow to shoulder his arms. This was full just outside off, and he would've been bowled or lbw if Zampa had bowled the googly
free runs as Zampa's half-tracker on middle hits his pads and trickles down to the fine-leg fence
good length, outside off, and cut to Starc at point. Enough time to scurry across for a single though

good length, on middle, and the pull goes straight to midwicket! Morgan tried to pull along the ground, but he just couldn't keep it down. The wristspinner strikes! Good catch by Maxwell, who had to move to his left to take the catch
full outside off, and he clatters a drive, that founds cover
Hazlewood still going strong. Good length on off, and angling in, and the ball goes between bat and body as it zoots inwards at the very end. Through to Carey, who needs to dive to his left
fullish, outside off, and the attempted punch gets inside-edged to the leg side
good length, outside off, and he opens the bat's face to run it down to third man
good length, on off, and angling in. Defended off the back foot, and it rolls back to the bowler
good length, outside off, and guided to third man once again
good length, outside off, and cut to point. Can't find the gap though

Marnus takes a difficult catch at long off! Tossed up, tempting Buttler to go for the big one, and he shovels this in the air. Labuschagne has to race in from long off to take the catch, and he dives forward - definitely bruising his elbows in the process - to take the catch and send the dangerman back
full toss outside off, and he clubs a pull to midwicket
quicker ball, back of a length, outside off, and he cuts this to deep point
good length, just outside off, and cut to point, but not into the gap this time
appeal for lbw as he delivers the googly. Full on off, and turning inwards, and hitting his front leg. Appeal turned down and they don't review
full, on off, and fended with a giant stride
worked out to wide mid-on, straight to the fielder
length ball angling across him, 86mph/138kph, and defended by Bairstow
length ball pushed across him, driven to Mitch Marsh at mid-on
short ball, 87mph/139kph, Bairstow backs away shaping to cut and flashes at thin air
back of a length but down the leg side, Bairstow pulls and toe-ends it out to square leg for a couple
length ball, fraction of width outside the off stump and Bairstow hits the sweeper on the cover boundary to keep the strike
yorker, dug out to short midwicket
reverse-swept, no timing whatsoever but steals a single towards gully
skips down the pitch, and Zampa drops his length back. Billings nudges out to mid-off for one
gets across to the off side to sweep, struck on the pad and Australia appeal... but Millns says no! And there's no review. Outside the line, I think
gets down to sweep again as Zampa fires it through a little quicker. Can't beat the man in the ring on the 45
fullish in the off-stump channel, dead-batted towards cover
length ball, 88mph/142kph, and gloved towards the covers as Billings looks to defend
banged in on a length at 85mph/137kph, and nudged to square leg for a sharp single. Labuschagne throws at the bowler's end, but Billings is lightning-quick between the wickets
length on off stump, Bairstow shuffles across and works to midwicket
hard length, defended back down the pitch by Billings
pushed wider of the off stump, and guided down to third man for one
short ball, pulled away in front of square for a couple as Stoinis races round to his left on the boundary

googly hits the pads, prolonged appeal and Australia review this time as Millns says no! Height might be an issue here? Ultra-Edge confirms no bat involved. Impact in-line, but just missing the top of leg stump!
lunges forward to defend back towards the bowler
skips down the pitch to a length ball, defending to cover
googly on a length, pushed through quickly at 58mph/94kph and Billings defends awkwardly from deep in the crease
full and straight, Billings presents a straight bat and defends
low full toss, Billings premeditates and sweeps daintily out to deep backward square leg
straight length ball, nudged to short midwicket
length on off stump, steered straight to point with an open face
shuffles down to a back-of-a-length ball, nudging to midwicket
length ball, from tight to the stumps, and Billings inside-edges into his pads looking to play an on-drive
guided to point with an open face, tidy start for Marsh
length ball on the pads, clipped to square leg for a leg-bye
fullish on off stump, presses out to extra cover
skips down the pitch, driving uppishly through extra cover. Maxwell tips it round the post from in tight, diving to his right
gets down early to sweep hard out to Cummins at deep backward square

struck on the pad while sweeping, Zampa pleads with Millns who says no yet again! And Finch won't review this time. Billings got a long way across to the googly, and it probably hit him outside the line on the front pad EDIT: Hawk-Eye confirms it struck outside the line, and Billings was too far down the pitch, too
legbreak this time, and Billings gets down to sweep out to deep square
gets his head over this, nudging to cover
guided down to third man to get off strike - a relief after struggling against Marsh in his first over
length ball on off stump, clipped out to deep midwicket
nudged to mid-on
full on off stump, worked away behind square for a couple as Zampa gets round to his left from fine leg
length on the pads, clipped out to Zampa for another
steered towards gully, Billings sets off for a single but is sent back
drops short, Bairstow rocks back and nails him over midwicket for six! Picked the length up early, rocking onto the back foot and leathering Zampa into the stands
goes for a huge mow on the slog-sweep, and it misses everything! Legbreak which turned sharply past the bat, and past the off stump
half-a-dozen more! Full and straight, Bairstow sets himself and clubs it over midwicket again!
full and straight, slog-swept out to deep square on the bounce for a couple. Looked to go again, but didn't get all of it this time and Cummins got round well to his left
drops short, but gets away with it, and Bairstow pulls out to deep square
fullish on off stump, Billings looks to sweep but only manages to get a glove on it, and it dribbles pathetically into the leg side
banged in on a length, little inside-edge into the back thigh and it drops down at his feet
clipped off the hip through square leg for a very sharp two as they take on Stoinis' arm. Carey whips the bails off but Bairstow is rapid. And that brings up his fifty, his slowest in ODIs
length on off stump, pushed out to mid-on
length ball on fourth stump, Billings shapes to pull but only manages to bottom edge into his front knee. Didn't quite get up off the pitch

loud appeal... not really sure what for? Australia won't review. Nipped in a fraction from a length and struck Billings above the knee from a long way down the pitch as he looked to work to leg. No sign of an inside edge, so it must have been an lbw shout, and Hawk-Eye confirms it struck outside the line
slightly fuller length, and Bairstow works towards short midwicket
length on fifth stump, jammed behind square on the off side for a scampered single
wide on the crease, a bit of width and Billings frees his arms, driving uppishly through the infield for four! He leans back while playing the shot, but gets it through the ring
beauty from Cummins! Great comeback, hint of seam movement and good bounce from wide on the crease to take it past the outside edge
banged in on a length, Billings defends from the crease

short ball, gloved agonisingly out of Carey's reach and away for four! Good battle this, Billings was through the pull too early, and it looped up off the hand over the keeper's head and beat fine leg

top-edges another pull, but it flies away over the rope for six this time! Short ball, Billings was too late on it this time and it looped up over the rope, over the boundary, and into the car park on the bounce
loosener, down the leg side on a length
another pie down the leg side, Bairstow jumps into position on the pull and just sneaks it past fine leg in the ring. They scamper back for a second run on the throw from deep square
leg theory from Maxwell, clipped to fine leg's left hand in the ring for one more
pushed feebly into the leg side with the bottom hand off the bat. Fairly uppish, but lands in no-man's-land and they take one
angled across Bairstow with a round-arm action, and they sneak a single to short third man as he guides it down with an open face
length outside leg stump, clipped out to deep backward square
speared in on a length, clipped out to square leg
length in the channel outside off, Bairstow flashes cross-batted and can't lay bat on it
rushes him with a back-of-a-length ball. Bairstow takes on the pull but then pulls out, and it smacks him on the right biceps, dribbling away into the off side
clipped out to midwicket for one
in the slot outside off, and moosed into the stands over straight midwicket! My word, that came out of nowhere! Bairstow set himself deep in the crease, and short-arm jabbed him over the rope for six
opens the face, steering past the diving Maxwell at backward point
beaten outside off! Beauty in the channel, and Billings' hopeful grope only manages to connect with thin air
very short bouncer to start, which loops harmlessly over Bairstow's head and is called wide. And the third umpire reckons he overstepped too, so there's a free hit coming up

Bairstow clears the front leg and heaves this high and mighty into the leg side... but there's more elevation than distance, and Labuschagne settles under it. He drops it - not that it would have counted - and England sneak back for two
clipped off the pads out to deep square
harmless length ball outside off, guided down to third man to keep England ticking over
how did that miss?! Length ball, looked like an offcutter from Stoinis, which flew just over the top of middle-and-leg as Bairstow was through the shot early
length outside off, Bairstow swings and misses at it looking to pull

clears the front leg to give himself room, cutting a straight length ball for four behind square! Premeditated from Bairstow, who I think was looking to wipe this over midwicket again, but Stoinis hung it wide and he adapted brilliantly
length on fifth stump, 88mph/142kph, and steered towards point
hard length on fourth stump, guided to point again by Billings

length ball angling in from wide on the crease, nudged towards Mitch Marsh, diving to his left at short midwicket. Billings and Bairstow both thought about the single, but eventually decided against it

slightly back of a length, and Billings pulls awkwardly, bottom-edging in front of square. It races away to the sweeper's left on the leg side boundary, and somehow gets away for four! Didn't look like he'd timed it at all, but enough power from the bottom hand to get to the fence
flicked off the hip down towards fine leg for one
length ball, inside-edged into the pads. Cummins bellows out an appeal, but almost certainly bat first, and there's no suggestion of a review
good length, just outside off, and he plays the late cut to third man
back of a length, on middle, and worked away to square leg off his hips
good length, on off, and skidding in. Defended off the back foot
good length, on middle, and he shuffles across before clipping it to fine leg. Another two for the batsmen
good length, just outside off. Walks forward to defend from near his chest
good length, just outside off, and he bends his knees to cut to deep point
Starc around the wicket, full on off and worked to midwicket
looks to work this ball to the leg side but a leading edge takes it to the other side
overpitched, almost a yorker, and shoveled to extra cover
full on off, and he check drives down the ground but can't beat mid on
full toss ish, on off, and smacked to cover
faster, just outside off, slightly full, and the ball goes past off stump before he could get his bat down
full, just outside off, and swept behind square, far from Stoinis at deep midwicket
skiddy length ball on off, but turning away. He tries to sweep again, but misses, and hits his front leg, but impact is outside off
full on leg, and he clears his front let to tonk a shot to long on
good length, on off, and he comes down the wicket to tap it to cover
half-tracker on middle, and pulled to deep midwicket. One bounce to Stoinis
straight past the bowler! Full and punished
full on off, and worked to mid on
going, going, gone! Back of a length, and he waits on the back foot and hammers a pull over deep midwicket! Using the short boundary well
low full toss while attempting the yorker. Struck back, and Starc dives to stop. May have tweaked a muscle in his leg.
back of a length, outside off, and left alone
back of a length on middle, and angling down leg, but the umpire doesn't call this wide.
overpitched on off, and struck to long off

The gamble pays off! Full on off, and he goes for the slog, but comes off the bat's toe. In the air for a while as it settles at around cow corner, and Hazlewood - at long on - dives diagonally to his right to take the catch while diving. Is that the game?
good length outside off, and cut with the turn in front of square. A couple more
good length, on off, and he nearly chops this onto his stumps. Hits Carey's pads instead
full on off, and defended softly
good length on middle, and worked with the turn to square leg. Keeps the strike
full on off, and tapped to mid off
good length, on leg, and nudged off his pads to the leg side
full, just outside off, and drilled off the front foot to cover
fuller than usual, and he toe-ends the drive back to Hazlewood
back of a length, on middle, and gloved off his waist to the leg side to get to his fifty
good length, on off, and tapped to extra cover
full outside off from around the wicket. Driven to cover
good length, on middle and angling in. Fended off the back foot
full on middle, and he presses forward to defend. Bat-padded and that keeps Maxwell interested for an lbw appeal. Not given and they don't review
good length, on off, and punched to extra cover
good length, angling in, and worked to square leg
full on off, and he slices this over cover, but lands safe
good length, on off, and he opens the bat's face to run it down to third man
full, outside off, and the straight drive is spliced to wide mid on
back of a length, on leg, and he half-attempts the pull. Ball goes over his shoulder and they appeal for caught behind but there was absolutely no bat involved
taken at cover! Full on off, and he tries to drive but he's sliced it straight to the fielder
good length on off and angling into middle. Fended straight back
full, on off, nearly a yorker. Defended back. Three maidens in his 3 for 26
full on leg, and hits his front leg as Billings misses the flick. But the ball would've missed leg stump and so the appeal is turned down
full on middle, and he comes down the wicket before guiding an on drive between midwicket and long on!
length ball outside leg, and he comes down the wicket to hammer a shot to midwicket
full on middle, and flicked to deep midwicket
full on leg, and he comes down the wicket to find the gap in front of deep midwicket for a single
good length, on off. Punched to cover for a quick single
full on off, and driven beautifully over the fielder at cover!
good length, just outside off, and he runs it down to point
aggressive! In the slot, and he comes down the wicket and then swipes it leg side to hit a six over deep midwicket
full and wide, and he comes down the wicket but is beaten by the line that is too far from him
full and wide, and he toe-ends a drive back to the bowler
full and very wide, and slapped to deep point for two more. Thirteen off the over
fullish, just outside off and turning away. Cut to deep point but just a single this time
full on off, and the reverse sweep beats backward point!
full on off, and he comes down the wicket to drive. One bounce to the bowler
another one! Reverse swept between point and deep cover this time. Fielder in the deep - Cummins - dives, gets a hand to it, but can't stop it from dribbling away to the boundary skirting
good length, outside off and turning away. Cut, but finds cover
tosses it up, on leg, and nudges it to square leg
full outside off from around the wicket. Billings goes for a wild cross-batted heave but misses the shot altogether
full on off, nearly a yorker, but he smacks it past the umpire for four! Fast hands on display
falls between two people! Short, outside off, and he top edges the pull. Falls between the keeper and fine leg... around the vacant square-leg region
yorker length, on leg, and hits his boot and dribbles away to short third man
full outside off, and he goes for a wild cross-batted slog. Misses

Starc's missed that! Yorker on middle, that lands up near the stumps at the batsman's end. They scurry for a single and Starc tries to boot the ball onto the stumps but he misses! Shades of Diana Ross at the 1994 Football World Cup opening ceremony
full outside off, and he lifts this over cover for a single
full on middle and leg, and he reverse sweeps at deep point. Nearly fell over losing balance while playing that
that's four! Full on off, and he goes to clear long off, but doesn't have the distance. Comfortable catch in the deep
full on off, and reverse swept over backward point! Brave...
full on leg stump, adjusting his line knowing Billings will attempt the reverse sweep. Finds deep point this time
Rashid survives the ball off his opposite number. But barely just. Full on off, and a leading edge takes the ball over Zampa's head
starts off with an extra. Goes for the wide yorker, but a tad too wide
full and wide, and he opens the bat's face to dig this away behind square, between deep point and third man
full toss outside off, and begging to be hit, but he misses the swing One bounce to Carey
back of a length, and pulled in front of square. Protection in the deep though
That went very high! Good length, outside off, and he tries to flat bat it over long off. But scooped in the air, and Maxwell from cover gets under it to take a swirling catch
slower ball bouncer, outside off, and he drags the pull to deep midwicket
full outside off, and tonked to deep midwicket. Goes to him on the bounce
yorker length, on middle and leg. Struck right back, past the bowler, to mid off
another yorker length ball on middle, and shoveled to mid off. This time they scamper across for the single
back of a length, just outside off, and tapped to cover for a quick single
innovative! Knew Starc would probably go for the yorker length, so he shuffles across and ramps this over fine leg for four
back of a length, slower ball, Billings lets it go thinking it would be a wide for height. Not given
yorker length, just outside off, and Billings can't connect. That was really close to the off stump
gives the strike to Billings. Full toss outside off, and caressed to cover
that would've hurt Cummins as Billings smacks this yorker length ball back to the bowler. Hits his foot before rolling away to mid off
back of a length, outside off, enough width to cut but Archer's beaten by the lack of pace. On the bounce to Carey
slower ball, wide outside off, and the ball stays quite low. Through to the keeper again
full on off, and he backs away before hammering a drive to cover
another slower ball, wide outside off, but just inside the tram lines as Billings misses the cut.
full toss, on off. Backs away to crunch a shot to mid off
low full toss, angling into leg stump. Cramped for space, and he swipes this down to long on
knee-high full toss, and clubbed to long on
hits the grille of his helmet as he misses the pull. They'll need to check up on Billings for a prospective concussion as per new rules. Short ball, angling into leg.
yorker length, on leg, and dug away back to the bowler. They scamper across for the single, with Starc trying to effect a run out at the batsman's end but the throw was poor
low full toss, on off, and clubbed to cover.
there's the hundred! A well deserved one, even if it doesn't come in a win. Good length, outside off, and he pulls along the ground to the deep midwicket fence. He came in at 57 for 4!
good length, wide outside off, and the slower ball goes under his bat. Misses the wild leg-side swipe
full and quite wide. He gives Cummins a charge and flat-bats a shot down the ground
picks the slower ball early, and hammers this good length ball cross-batted to deep midwicket
oh dear, game on is it? Full and very wide, but he runs across the stumps and paddle-ramps a shot to the vacant fine-leg region for four!
Keeps the strike, and that means England need 28 off six balls off the part timer. Cummins super expensive tonight. Yorker length outside off, and tapped to midwicket
back of a length, on middle, and he misses the pull. Glances his helmet, past the keeper, and they take a single
good length, on middle, and pulled to wide long on
back of a length on off, and pulled! In the gap between deep midwicket and deep backward square leg
good length, on middle, and thumped to wide long on
good length, on middle, and pulled to the leg side
perishes off the last ball! Full on off, and toe-ends it to long on! Australia win by 19 runs and they go 1-0 in the three-match series
